intro: Lobelia canariensis, commonly known as the Canary Island lobelia, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features showy, tubular blue to violet flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Lobelia canariensis is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
